response:
The clinical picture of dissemination in space (optic nerve and cerebellum) and likely time (subacute onset) in a 45-year-old female is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating disorder. Multiple Sclerosis is the most probable diagnosis. NMOSD and MOGAD are key differentials given the prominent optic neuritis. Systemic inflammatory and infectious causes must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder", "MOG-Antibody Disease", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Beh\u00e7et's Disease", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus", "Lyme Disease", "Syphilis"]
